snippet: The International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies reported Thursday that its burial teams in Guinea have been attacked verbally or physically 10 times a month on average since March.
abstract: Red Cross burial teams in Guinea are being attacked by family members and friends of those who have died from Ebola, complicating efforts to stop spread of disease.

byline.contributor: Aurelien Breeden contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: The International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies reported Thursday that its burial teams in Guinea have been attacked verbally or physically 10 times a month on average since March.

headline.main: Red Cross Faces Attacks at Ebola Victims’ Funerals
headline.print_headline: Red Cross Faces Attacks at Ebola Victims’ Funerals

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies
